general_advisory: As per IMD there may be chances of Very light to light rain, so farmers are advised to harvest matured paddy crops as soon as possible and store them in a safe place. Provide stacking to fruits & vegetables. Harvestable vegetables should be plucked before rain and disposed to the market.

advisory: If the crop has already been harvested, store them in a safe place by covering with a polythene sheet.
Paddy is in the harvesting stage. If the panicle turns 85% yellow and matured, then go for harvesting of the crop.
Make the threshing floor and storage godown clean and disinfectant the same.
Withhold application of fertilizer and pesticides for the time being.
Drain out excess water from the field.
Make arrangement for covering a plastic cover or polythene sheet for vegetables nursery like chilli and brinjal and cole crops.
Keep the drainage channels open to drain out excess rainwater from vegetable crops.
Postpone spraying operations of pesticide & foliar fertilizer application.
Harvestable vegetables should be plucked before rain and disposed to the market.
Provide mechanical support to fruit plants to prevent lodging.
Pluck the matured fruit before rainfall & disposed to the market.
Cover plastic bag to the fruits of banana.

As the winter is in the starting phase, there is a possibility of 'EUS' disease in fish. Farmers are advised to apply 'Cifax' @ 400 ml mixed with 40 litres of water in one acre pond area as a preventive measure.
The fishes should be fed daily with oil cake bran mixture at the rate of 2-3% of their total biomass.

Animals should be given mineral mixture along with salt regularly and wheat grains, jaggery etc. may be provided @ 10% -20% in the daily ration during the winter season to meet the energy requirement of the animals.
Keep the animal inside the shed.
Avoid mixing of rainwater into the drinking water of animals.
